Pair Indices

pairwise.Rd

A utility function to determine indices for pairwise comparisons.

pairwise(N)

Arguments

N

a single numeric value representing the total number of things to undergo pairwise comparison.

Value

Returns a two column numeric matrix giving the indices for all pairs.

References

Grant, B.J. et al. (2006) Bioinformatics 22, 2695--2696.

Author

Barry Grant

See also

seqidentity

Examples

  pairwise(3)
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]    1    2
#> [2,]    1    3
#> [3,]    2    3
  pairwise(20)
#>        [,1] [,2]
#>   [1,]    1    2
#>   [2,]    1    3
#>   [3,]    1    4
#>   [4,]    1    5
#>   [5,]    1    6
#>   [6,]    1    7
#>   [7,]    1    8
#>   [8,]    1    9
#>   [9,]    1   10
#>  [10,]    1   11
#>  [11,]    1   12
#>  [12,]    1   13
#>  [13,]    1   14
#>  [14,]    1   15
#>  [15,]    1   16
#>  [16,]    1   17
#>  [17,]    1   18
#>  [18,]    1   19
#>  [19,]    1   20
